Not at all in the mood to post but - I feel that if I don't get this off my chest I am going to blow. My father has been in and out of the hospital doing series of tests. He has been feeding us BS, last night I found out that the DR told him he saw spots on his Liver and it is most likely Cancer but he wants to run tests to confirm his already bad theory. He was waiting ot have the final results before he told us? Maybe - but we could have been there for him until thenm, during and after then. So I was sad and upset about what I found out but I am usualy pretty good at denying shit or at least putting it way down there where no one can tell or where I don't think about it too much... until A) My mother calls me and tells me I need to start thinking about funeral arrangements and calling to find out prices and so on.... or B) I get the full facts from the DR. When option A happens before B it makes for a very bad night, day, week. I know it is reality, shit happens - too much shit lately - but I was doing good with the thought that maybe my dad just contracted one of these weird bugs that no one else gets but him again and that the test results would be negative. Or that yes he has spots but they are not cancerous or that it is caught early enough to be able to fix it and make it all go away. Whatever the case may be, I was OK because I knew that August 18th I would know what the verdict is and that I would deal with it then. My dad is only 57, he has never really been very sick besides hernias and his vasectomy... He has had freak accidents but nothing life threatning. Everyone has been dying... both my grandmothers, my Aunt who was like my 3rd grandma, both my In-laws just a bunch of people, friends of friends and so on my mother who has had a heart attack at Christmas (she made it and is doing well thank god)- it's messed up. I know I am getting ahead here, but it is NOT time for him, EITHER, of my parents to go. It's not time for them to be sick and weak and suffering and not able to enjoy what they once did. My father is always walking around, to the park, downtown, to his siter, my place... hes a big time walker - being in a hospital bed is going to distroy him, not the Cancer, he will feel trapped, lonely, unhappy. To top it all off, he is the closest thing 9the only thing) to a father that my son has and I can't bare to tell him that Grandpa is sick, or going to die or whatever.
